publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3552 Jamie Hepburn: Release of Iraq War Minutes Vetoed—That the Parliament condemns the decision of the Secretary of State for Justice, Jack Straw MP, to veto the release of UK Government cabinet minutes that relate to the legality of the decision of the UK Government to go to war with Iraq in 2003; believes that the decision to veto the request of the Information Tribunal undermines the credibility of freedom of information laws, and further believes that the UK Government should launch a full inquiry into the legality of the decision to go to war with Iraq. Supported by: Bill Wilson*, Shirley-Anne Somerville*, Christopher Harvie*, Rob Gibson*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Alasdair Allan*, Anne McLaughlin*, Christina McKelvie*, Michael Matheson*, Christine Grahame*, Sandra White*, Bill Kidd*

S3M-3552 Jamie Hepburn: Release of Iraq War Minutes Vetoed—That the Parliament condemns the decision of the Secretary of State for Justice, Jack Straw MP, to veto the release of UK Government cabinet minutes that relate to the legality of the decision of the UK Government to go to war with Iraq in 2003; believes that the decision to veto the request of the Information Tribunal undermines the credibility of freedom of information laws, and further believes that the UK Government should launch a full inquiry into the legality of the decision to go to war with Iraq. Supported by: Bill Wilson, Shirley-Anne Somerville, Christopher Harvie, Rob Gibson, Joe FitzPatrick, Alasdair Allan, Anne McLaughlin, Christina McKelvie, Michael Matheson, Christine Grahame, Sandra White, Bill Kidd, Bob Doris*, Patrick Harvie*, Hugh O’Donnell*
S3M-3552 Release of Iraq War Minutes Vetoed (lodged on 26 February 2009) Gil Paterson*
S3M-3552 Release of Iraq War Minutes Vetoed (lodged on 26 February 2009) Dave Thompson*
S3M-3552 Release of Iraq War Minutes Vetoed (lodged on 26 February 2009) Stuart McMillan*
